definitions.definition: To turn to the advantage of.
examples: I availed myself of the opportunity.
Artifices will not avail the sinner in the day of judgment.

definitions.definition: To be of use or advantage; to answer or serve the purpose ; to have strength, force, or efficacy sufficient to accomplish the object.
examples: The plea in court must avail .
Medicines will not avail to halt the disease.

definitions.definition: To provide ; to make available ; to use or take advantage of (an opportunity or available resource).
examples: You can avail discounts on food.

main_definition: ( transitive , often reflexive ) To turn to the advantage of. [ ( chiefly ) with of ]
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To be of service to.
( intransitive ) To be of use or advantage; to answer or serve the purpose ; to have strength, force, or efficacy sufficient to accomplish the object.
( India , Africa , elsewhere proscribed ) To provide ; to make available ; to use or take advantage of (an opportunity or available resource).
